title: (x) Speak Up logo - hand lettered {Jes
content:
This might have been asked before, but what is the face used on Speak Up. The one used for the words Speak Up.   
   
 [http://www.underconsideration.com/speakup/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121144502/http:/www.underconsideration.com/speakup/)   
   
I've looked at Veer, but can't find an exact match.   
Any help would be appreciated. Thanks!

 [‹ Archive through September 17, 2004](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121144502/http:/www.typophile.com/node/7057 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Shaft movie lettering - ITC Pioneer {Ignacio} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121144502/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6716 "Go to next forum topic")
author: karen

comments.content: I think this is custom work by Underware, if I'm not mistaken. It's similar to their logo for [Typeradio](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121144502/http:/www.typeradio.org/), and rather distinctive, too.
Super! Thanks for the links guys. What would I do without typophile?

\> Stupid things, and being bored..   
   
Hehe, is that what you've been up to? I notice you haven't been around much. Or is it just me? ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121144502im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Nah, that's me having been away on a holiday for a week,   
doing nothing, but I wasn't bored: I had to catch up on my   
reading.

> * * *
> **quote:**
> 
> I notice you haven't been around much.
> 
> * * *

Hehe, is that your subtle way of telling me the Type ID Board   
is a mess? ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121144502im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) I'll get to it (this weekend I hope) but I'm pretty   
busy professionnally so I haven't got much downtime right   
now. Please bear with me for the moment.

Hey Yves, welcome back!   
   
\>\>I had to catch up on my   
reading. \<\<   
   
Anything interesting outside the type field?
